meanings.definition: To cause slight irritation or discomfort to
meanings.sent1: The loud noise from the construction site can annoy the neighbors.
meanings.sent2: The buzzing mosquito can annoy you while you try to sleep.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy likes to annoy the sleepy cat by barking at it.
meanings.sent4: The dripping faucet can annoy you like a persistent drumbeat.
meanings.sent5: The scratchy tag on the shirt can annoy your skin all day long.

meanings.sent1: The persistent sales calls can annoy people during dinner.
meanings.sent2: The constant honking of car horns can annoy pedestrians on the street.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel likes to annoy the birds by stealing their food.
meanings.sent4: The never-ending rain can annoy you like a nagging companion.
meanings.sent5: The repetitive ticking of the clock can annoy you in a quiet room.

meanings.definition: To be a source of irritation or annoyance to
meanings.sent1: The scratchy fabric can annoy sensitive skin.
meanings.sent2: The flickering light can annoy anyone trying to read.
meanings.sent3: The misaligned picture frame can annoy the perfectionist in the room.
meanings.sent4: The broken record can annoy you with its repetitive sound.
meanings.sent5: The squeaky door can annoy everyone in the house.
